description: Alaska Airlines was founded in 1932 as McGee Airways and later adopted the name Alaska Airlines in 1944. Initially, it operated as a small regional airline in Alaska, but it expanded its operations over the years to cover various destinations across the United States, Canada, Mexico, and beyond.Alaska Airlines has partnerships with several international airlines, allowing passengers to access an extensive network of destinations worldwide
Title: Business Class
ClassDes: Alaska Airlines offers a premium cabin experience known as Alaska First Class rather than a traditional Business Class. Passengers in Alaska First Class enjoy wider seats with extra legroom compared to standard economy seats.  Alaska Airlines offers complimentary premium dining options in First Class.Depending on the aircraft, First Class passengers may have access to in-flight entertainment systems

description: Virgin America was a U.S.-based airline that operated from 2007 to 2018. It was known for its distinctive branding, innovative approach to customer service, and focus on providing a unique and stylish flying experience.Virgin America was founded by British entrepreneur Sir Richard Branson's Virgin Group. It began operations in August 2007 with its inaugural flight from New York City to San Francisco.
Title: Business Class
ClassDes: Virgin America did not offer a traditional Business Class cabin. Instead, it offered a premium cabin called First Class, which provided passengers with a higher level of service and amenities compared to the main cabin (economy class).First Class passengers enjoyed wider seats with extra legroom compared to the main cabin. The seats were typically arranged in a 2-2 configuration on Virgin America's Airbus A320 aircraft. They offered enhanced comfort, with adjustable headrests and ample recline

description: Austrian Airlines, often referred to simply as Austrian, is the flag carrier airline of Austria, headquartered at Vienna International Airport in Schwechat.Austrian Airlines was founded in 1957 as Österreichische Luftverkehrs AG through the merger of Austrian Airways and Air Austria. It commenced operations in 1958 and has since grown to become one of Europe's leading airlines.
ClassDes: Airlines Business Class cabins feature comfortable and spacious seats that can recline into fully lie-flat beds on long-haul routes. Each seat is equipped with adjustable headrests, lumbar support, and ample legroom to ensure a restful journey.Each Business Class seat is equipped with a personal entertainment system, offering a wide range of movies, TV shows, music, and games on-demand

description: WestJet Airlines is a Canadian low-cost airline headquartered in Calgary, Alberta.WestJet was founded in 1996 by Clive Beddoe and a group of Calgary-based investors. It began operations in 1996 with a small fleet of Boeing 737 aircraft and initially served destinations within Western Canada.

description: Japan Airlines (JAL), also known as Nihon Kōkū Kabushiki-gaisha in Japanese, is the flag carrier airline of Japan.Japan Airlines was founded in 1951 and commenced operations in 1952. It was initially established as a state-owned airline and later privatized in 1987. Since then, it has grown to become one of the largest and most prominent airlines in Asia.

description: Qantas Airways, commonly referred to as Qantas, is the flag carrier airline of Australia and one of the world's oldest and most renowned airlines.Qantas was founded in November 1920 in Winton, Queensland, Australia, making it the third oldest airline in the world. The name Qantas stands for Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services. The airline commenced operations with its inaugural flight in 1921.

description: Air serbia  is the national flag carrier of Serbia, headquartered in Belgrade.Air Serbia traces its origins back to the former Yugoslavia's national carrier, JAT Yugoslav Airlines, founded in 1947. After the dissolution of Yugoslavia, JAT was rebranded as Air Serbia in 2013 following a strategic partnership with Etihad Airways,the national airline of the United Arab Emirates.

description: Finnair is the national flag carrier airline of Finland, headquartered in Vantaa, near Helsinki. description: Caribbean Airlines was founded in 2006, following the closure of its predecessor, BWIA West Indies Airways. description: Porter Airlines was founded in 2006 by Robert J. Deluce, a Canadian aviation entrepreneur. The airline commenced operations in October 2006 with its hub at Billy Bishop Toronto City Airport, offering short-haul flights to select destinations in Eastern Canada and the United States..

description: Hawaiian Airlines was founded in 1929 as Inter-Island Airways and commenced operations in 1930. It initially operated as a regional carrier within Hawaii, offering passenger and cargo services between the Hawaiian Islands. Over the years, Hawaiian Airlines expanded its operations to include transpacific flights, connecting Hawaii to destinations in North America, Asia, and Oceania.

description: Frontier Airlines was founded in 1994 as a low-cost carrier, initially operating as a regional airline based in Denver. Over the years, it underwent several ownership changes and rebranding efforts. In 2008, Frontier Airlines filed for bankruptcy and was subsequently acquired by Republic Airways Holdings. In 2013, Frontier transitioned into an ultra-low-cost carrier model under the ownership of Indigo Partners, focusing on offering low fares with additional fees for optional services.

description: Endeavor Air was founded in 1985 as Express Airlines I and operated as a regional carrier under various names before becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary of Delta Air Lines. description: Southwest Airlines Co. is a major airline based in the United States operating with a low-cost carrier model. It is headquartered in Dallas, Texas, and has scheduled service to 121 destinations in the United States and 10 additional countries. As of 2018, Southwest carried more domestic passengers than any other United States airline.It is currently the third largest airline in North America based on passengers flown.

description: JetBlue Airways, legally known as JetBlue Airways Corporation and commonly stylized as jetBlue, is a major United States low-cost airline headquartered in the Long Island City neighborhood of the New York City borough of Queens. It also maintains corporate offices in Utah and Florida.JetBlue operates over 1,000 flights daily and serves 100 domestic and international network destinations in the Americas and Europe.The airline operates out of six hubs, with its primary being New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport.

description: Spirit Airlines, Inc. (stylized as spirit) is a major United States ultra-low cost airline headquartered in Miramar, Florida, in the Miami metropolitan area. Spirit operates scheduled flights throughout the United States, the Caribbean and Latin America. Spirit was the seventh largest passenger carrier in North America as of 2023, as well as the largest ultra-low-cost carrier in North America.
